Make sure your Scene has an EventSystem. public override void OnPointerClick(PointerEventData eventData) Parameters eventData PointerEventData Pointer Data associated with the event. Typically by the event system. Examples //Attatch this script to a Button GameObject using UnityEngine; using UnityEngine.EventSystems; public class Example : MonoBehaviour, IPointerClickHandler { //Detect if a click occurs public void OnPointerClick(PointerEventData pointerEventData) { //Use this to tell when the user right-clicks on the Button if (pointerEventData.button == PointerEventData.InputButton.Right) { //Output to console the clicked GameObject's name and the following message. You can replace this with your own actions for when clicking the GameObject. Debug.Log(name + " Game Object Right Clicked!"); } //Use this to tell when the user left-clicks on the Button if (pointerEventData.button == PointerEventData.InputButton.Left) { Debug.Log(name + " Game Object Left Clicked!"); } } } OnPointerDown(PointerEventData) Evaluate current state and transition to pressed state. public override void OnPointerDown(PointerEventData eventData) Parameters eventData PointerEventData Examples using UnityEngine; } } OnPointerExit(PointerEventData) Evaluate current state and transition to normal state. public override void OnPointerExit(PointerEventData eventData) Parameters eventData PointerEventData Examples using UnityEngine; api/Framework.Win32API.MessageBoxButtons.title: Enum Win32API.MessageBoxButtons | PD
api/Framework.Win32API.MessageBoxButtons.keywords: Enum Win32API.MessageBoxButtons Namespace Framework Assembly Framework.dll public enum Win32API.MessageBoxButtons Extension Methods I18NUtil.I18NNumberPercent0<T>(T) I18NUtil.I18NNumberPercent2<T>(T) I18NUtil.I18NNumberThousand<T>(T) Fields AbortRetryIgnore = 2 The message box contains three push buttons: Abort, Retry, and Ignore. CancelTryIgnore = 6 The message box contains three push buttons: Cancel, Try Again, Continue. Help = 16384 Adds a Help button to the message box. Ok = 0 The message box contains one push button: OK. This is the default. OkCancel = 1 The message box contains two push buttons: OK and Cancel. RetryCancel = 5 The message box contains two push buttons: Retry and Cancel. YesNo = 4 The message box contains two push buttons: Yes and No. YesNoCancel = 3 The message box contains three push buttons: Yes, No, and Cancel.

api/Framework.Win32API.MessageBoxIcon.ht.title: Enum Win32API.MessageBoxIcon | PD
api/Framework.Win32API.MessageBoxIcon.ht.keywords: Enum Win32API.MessageBoxIcon Namespace Framework Assembly Framework.dll To display an icon in the message box, specify one of the following values. public enum Win32API.MessageBoxIcon : uint Extension Methods I18NUtil.I18NNumberPercent0<T>(T) I18NUtil.I18NNumberPercent2<T>(T) I18NUtil.I18NNumberThousand<T>(T) Fields Error = 16 A stop-sign icon appears in the message box. Information = 64 An icon consisting of a lowercase letter i in a circle appears in the message box. Question = 32 A question-mark icon appears in the message box. Warning = 48 An exclamation-point icon appears in the message box.

api/Framework.Win32API.MessageBoxModal.h.title: Enum Win32API.MessageBoxModal | PD
api/Framework.Win32API.MessageBoxModal.h.keywords: Enum Win32API.MessageBoxModal Namespace Framework Assembly Framework.dll To indicate the modality of the dialog box, specify one of the following values. public enum Win32API.MessageBoxModal : uint Extension Methods I18NUtil.I18NNumberPercent0<T>(T) I18NUtil.I18NNumberPercent2<T>(T) I18NUtil.I18NNumberThousand<T>(T) Fields Application = 0 The user must respond to the message box before continuing work in the window identified by the hWnd parameter. However, the user can move to the windows of other threads and work in those windows. Depending on the hierarchy of windows in the application, the user may be able to move to other windows within the thread. All child windows of the parent of the message box are automatically disabled, but pop-up windows are not. System = 4096 Same as Application except that the message box has the Top Most style. Use system-modal message boxes to notify the user of serious, potentially damaging errors that require immediate attention (for example, running out of memory). Task = 8192 Same as Application except that all the top-level windows belonging to the current thread are disabled if the hWnd parameter is NULL. Use this flag when the calling application or library does not have a window handle available but still needs to prevent input to other windows in the calling thread without suspending other threads.

api/Framework.Win32API.MessageBoxResult..title: Enum Win32API.MessageBoxResult | PD
api/Framework.Win32API.MessageBoxResult..keywords: Enum Win32API.MessageBoxResult Namespace Framework Assembly Framework.dll The message box returns an integer value that indicates which button the user clicked. public enum Win32API.MessageBoxResult Extension Methods I18NUtil.I18NNumberPercent0<T>(T) I18NUtil.I18NNumberPercent2<T>(T) I18NUtil.I18NNumberThousand<T>(T) Fields Abort = 3 The 'Abort' button was selected. Cancel = 2 The 'Cancel' button was selected. Continue = 11 The 'Continue' button was selected. Ignore = 5 The 'Ignore' button was selected. No = 7 The 'No' button was selected. Ok = 1 The 'OK' button was selected. Retry = 10 The 'Retry' button was selected. Yes = 6 The 'Yes' button was selected.

api/Global.BufferPoolNodeList-1.html.keywords: Class BufferPoolNodeList<T> Namespace Global Assembly Framework.dll This improved version of the System.Collections.Generic.List that doesn't release the buffer on Clear(), resulting in better performance and less garbage collection. PRO: BetterList performs faster than List when you Add and Remove items (although slower if you remove from the beginning). CON: BetterList performs worse when sorting the list. api/Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream..title: Class RecyclableMemoryStream | PD
api/Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStream..keywords: Class RecyclableMemoryStream Namespace Microsoft.IO Assembly Framework.dll MemoryStream implementation that deals with pooling and managing memory streams which use potentially large buffers. public sealed class RecyclableMemoryStream : MemoryStream, IDisposable, IAsyncDisposable Inheritance object MarshalByRefObject Stream MemoryStream RecyclableMemoryStream Implements IDisposable IAsyncDisposable Inherited Members MemoryStream.CopyToAsync(Stream, int, CancellationToken) MemoryStream.Flush() MemoryStream.FlushAsync(CancellationToken) MemoryStream.ReadAsync(byte[], int, int, CancellationToken) MemoryStream.TryGetBuffer(out ArraySegment<byte>) MemoryStream.WriteAsync(byte[], int, int, CancellationToken) MemoryStream.BeginRead(byte[], int, int, AsyncCallback, object) MemoryStream.BeginWrite(byte[], int, int, AsyncCallback, object) MemoryStream.CopyTo(Stream, int) MemoryStream.EndRead(IAsyncResult) MemoryStream.EndWrite(IAsyncResult) MemoryStream.Read(Span<byte>) MemoryStream.ReadAsync(Memory<byte>, CancellationToken) MemoryStream.Write(ReadOnlySpan<byte>) MemoryStream.WriteAsync(ReadOnlyMemory<byte>, CancellationToken) Stream.Null Stream.CopyTo(Stream) Stream.CopyToAsync(Stream) Stream.CopyToAsync(Stream, int) Stream.Dispose() Stream.FlushAsync() Stream.ReadAsync(byte[], int, int) Stream.Synchronized(Stream) Stream.WriteAsync(byte[], int, int) Stream.CopyToAsync(Stream, CancellationToken) Stream.DisposeAsync() Stream.ReadTimeout Stream.WriteTimeout MarshalByRefObject.CreateObjRef(Type) MarshalByRefObject.GetLifetimeService() MarshalByRefObject.InitializeLifetimeService() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks This class works in tandem with the RecylableMemoryStreamManager to supply MemoryStream objects to callers, while avoiding these specific problems: LOH allocations - since all large buffers are pooled, they will never incur a Gen2 GC Memory waste - A standard memory stream doubles its size when it runs out of room. This leads to continual memory growth as each stream approaches the maximum allowed size. Memory copying - Each time a MemoryStream grows, all the bytes are copied into new buffers. This implementation only copies the bytes when GetBuffer is called. Memory fragmentation - By using homogeneous buffer sizes, it ensures that blocks of memory can be easily reused. The stream is implemented on top of a series of uniformly-sized blocks. As the stream's length grows, additional blocks are retrieved from the memory manager. It is these blocks that are pooled, not the stream object itself. The biggest wrinkle in this implementation is when GetBuffer() is called. This requires a single contiguous buffer. If only a single block is in use, then that block is returned. If multiple blocks are in use, we retrieve a larger buffer from the memory manager. These large buffers are also pooled, split by size--they are multiples of a chunk size (1 MB by default). Once a large buffer is assigned to the stream the blocks are NEVER again used for this stream. All operations take place on the large buffer. The large buffer can be replaced by a larger buffer from the pool as needed. All blocks and large buffers are maintained in the stream until the stream is disposed (unless AggressiveBufferReturn is enabled in the stream manager). Constructors RecyclableMemoryStream(RecyclableMemoryStreamManager) Allocate a new RecyclableMemoryStream object. public RecyclableMemoryStream(RecyclableMemoryStreamManager memoryManager) Parameters memoryManager RecyclableMemoryStreamManager The memory manager RecyclableMemoryStream(RecyclableMemoryStreamManager, string) Allocate a new RecyclableMemoryStream object public RecyclableMemoryStream(RecyclableMemoryStreamManager memoryManager, string tag) Parameters memoryManager RecyclableMemoryStreamManager The memory manager tag string A string identifying this stream for logging and debugging purposes RecyclableMemoryStream(RecyclableMemoryStreamManager, string, int) Allocate a new RecyclableMemoryStream object public RecyclableMemoryStream(RecyclableMemoryStreamManager memoryManager, string tag, int requestedSize) Parameters memoryManager RecyclableMemoryStreamManager The memory manager tag string A string identifying this stream for logging and debugging purposes requestedSize int The initial requested size to prevent future allocations Properties CanRead Whether the stream can currently read public override bool CanRead { get; } Property Value bool CanSeek Whether the stream can currently seek public override bool CanSeek { get; } Property Value bool CanTimeout Always false public override bool CanTimeout { get; } Property Value bool CanWrite Whether the stream can currently write public override bool CanWrite { get; } Property Value bool Capacity Gets or sets the capacity public override int Capacity { get; set; } Property Value int Remarks Capacity is always in multiples of the memory manager's block size, unless the large buffer is in use. Capacity never decreases during a stream's lifetime. Explicitly setting the capacity to a lower value than the current value will have no effect. This is because the buffers are all pooled by chunks and there's little reason to allow stream truncation. Exceptions ObjectDisposedException Object has been disposed Length Gets the number of bytes written to this stream. public override long Length { get; } Property Value long Exceptions ObjectDisposedException Object has been disposed Position Gets the current position in the stream public override long Position { get; set; } Property Value long Exceptions ObjectDisposedException Object has been disposed Methods Close() Equivalent to Dispose public override void Close() Dispose(bool) Returns the memory used by this stream back to the pool. protected override void Dispose(bool disposing) Parameters disposing bool Whether we're disposing (true), or being called by the finalizer (false) ~RecyclableMemoryStream() protected ~RecyclableMemoryStream() GetBuffer() Returns a single buffer containing the contents of the stream. The buffer may be longer than the stream length. public override byte[] GetBuffer() Returns byte[] A byte[] buffer Remarks IMPORTANT: Doing a Write() after calling GetBuffer() invalidates the buffer. The old buffer is held onto until Dispose is called, but the next time GetBuffer() is called, a new buffer from the pool will be required. Exceptions ObjectDisposedException Object has been disposed Read(byte[], int, int) Reads from the current position into the provided buffer public override int Read(byte[] buffer, int offset, int count) Parameters buffer byte[] Destination buffer offset int Offset into buffer at which to start placing the read bytes. count int Number of bytes to read. Returns int The number of bytes read Exceptions ArgumentNullException buffer is null ArgumentOutOfRangeException offset or count is less than 0 ArgumentException offset subtracted from the buffer length is less than count ObjectDisposedException Object has been disposed ReadByte() Reads a single byte from the current position in the stream. public override int ReadByte() Returns int The byte at the current position, or -1 if the position is at the end of the stream. Exceptions ObjectDisposedException Object has been disposed Seek(long, SeekOrigin) Sets the position to the offset from the seek location public override long Seek(long offset, SeekOrigin loc) Parameters offset long How many bytes to move loc SeekOrigin From where Returns long The new position Exceptions ObjectDisposedException Object has been disposed ArgumentOutOfRangeException offset is larger than MaxStreamLength ArgumentException Invalid seek origin IOException Attempt to set negative position SetLength(long) Sets the length of the stream public override void SetLength(long value) Parameters value long Exceptions ArgumentOutOfRangeException value is negative or larger than MaxStreamLength ObjectDisposedException Object has been disposed ToArray() Returns a new array with a copy of the buffer's contents. You should almost certainly be using GetBuffer combined with the Length to access the bytes in this stream. Calling ToArray will destroy the benefits of pooled buffers, but it is included for the sake of completeness. api/Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamM.title: Class RecyclableMemoryStreamManager | PD
api/Microsoft.IO.RecyclableMemoryStreamM.keywords: Class RecyclableMemoryStreamManager Namespace Microsoft.IO Assembly Framework.dll Manages pools of RecyclableMemoryStream objects. public sealed class RecyclableMemoryStreamManager Inheritance object RecyclableMemoryStreamManager Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks There are two pools managed in here. The small pool contains same-sized buffers that are handed to streams as they write more data. For scenarios that need to call GetBuffer(), the large pool contains buffers of various sizes, all multiples of LargeBufferMultiple (1 MB by default). They are split by size to avoid overly-wasteful buffer usage. There should be far fewer 8 MB buffers than 1 MB buffers, for example. Constructors RecyclableMemoryStreamManager() Initializes the memory manager with the default block/buffer specifications. public RecyclableMemoryStreamManager() RecyclableMemoryStreamManager(int, int, int) Initializes the memory manager with the given block requiredSize. public RecyclableMemoryStreamManager(int blockSize, int largeBufferMultiple, int maximumBufferSize) Parameters blockSize int Size of each block that is pooled. Must be > 0. largeBufferMultiple int Each large buffer will be a multiple of this value. maximumBufferSize int Buffers larger than this are not pooled Exceptions ArgumentOutOfRangeException blockSize is not a positive number, or largeBufferMultiple is not a positive number, or maximumBufferSize is less than blockSize. ArgumentException maximumBufferSize is not a multiple of largeBufferMultiple Fields DefaultBlockSize public const int DefaultBlockSize = 131072 Field Value int DefaultLargeBufferMultiple public const int DefaultLargeBufferMultiple = 1048576 Field Value int DefaultMaximumBufferSize public const int DefaultMaximumBufferSize = 134217728 Field Value int Properties AggressiveBufferReturn Whether dirty buffers can be immediately returned to the buffer pool. E.g. when GetBuffer() is called on a stream and creates a single large buffer, if this setting is enabled, the other blocks will be returned to the buffer pool immediately. Note when enabling this setting that the user is responsible for ensuring that any buffer previously retrieved from a stream which is subsequently modified is not used after modification (as it may no longer be valid). public bool AggressiveBufferReturn { get; set; } Property Value bool BlockSize The size of each block. It must be set at creation and cannot be changed. public int BlockSize { get; } Property Value int GenerateCallStacks Whether to save callstacks for stream allocations. This can help in debugging. It should NEVER be turned on generally in production. public bool GenerateCallStacks { get; set; } Property Value bool LargeBufferMultiple All buffers are multiples of this number. It must be set at creation and cannot be changed. public int LargeBufferMultiple { get; } Property Value int LargeBuffersFree How many buffers are in the large pool public long LargeBuffersFree { get; } Property Value long LargePoolFreeSize Number of bytes in large pool not currently in use public long LargePoolFreeSize { get; } Property Value long LargePoolInUseSize Number of bytes currently in use by streams from the large pool public long LargePoolInUseSize { get; } Property Value long MaximumBufferSize Gets or sets the maximum buffer size. public int MaximumBufferSize { get; } Property Value int Remarks Any buffer that is returned to the pool that is larger than this will be discarded and garbage collected. MaximumFreeLargePoolBytes How many bytes of large free buffers to allow before we start dropping those returned to us. public long MaximumFreeLargePoolBytes { get; set; } Property Value long MaximumFreeSmallPoolBytes How many bytes of small free blocks to allow before we start dropping those returned to us. public long MaximumFreeSmallPoolBytes { get; set; } Property Value long MaximumStreamCapacity Maximum stream capacity in bytes. Attempts to set a larger capacity will result in an exception. public long MaximumStreamCapacity { get; set; } Property Value long Remarks A value of 0 indicates no limit. SmallBlocksFree How many blocks are in the small pool public long SmallBlocksFree { get; } Property Value long SmallPoolFreeSize Number of bytes in small pool not currently in use public long SmallPoolFreeSize { get; } Property Value long SmallPoolInUseSize Number of bytes currently in use by stream from the small pool public long SmallPoolInUseSize { get; } Property Value long Methods GetStream() Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with no tag and a default initial capacity. public MemoryStream GetStream() Returns MemoryStream A MemoryStream. GetStream(string) Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with the given tag and a default initial capacity. public MemoryStream GetStream(string tag) Parameters tag string A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream. Returns MemoryStream A MemoryStream. GetStream(string, byte[], int, int) Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with the given tag and with contents copied from the provided buffer. The provided buffer is not wrapped or used after construction. public MemoryStream GetStream(string tag, byte[] buffer, int offset, int count) Parameters tag string A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream. buffer byte[] The byte buffer to copy data from. offset int The offset from the start of the buffer to copy from. count int The number of bytes to copy from the buffer. Returns MemoryStream A MemoryStream. Remarks The new stream's position is set to the beginning of the stream when returned. GetStream(string, int) Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with the given tag and at least the given capacity. public MemoryStream GetStream(string tag, int requiredSize) Parameters tag string A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream. requiredSize int The minimum desired capacity for the stream. Returns MemoryStream A MemoryStream. GetStream(string, int, bool) Retrieve a new MemoryStream object with the given tag and at least the given capacity, possibly using a single continugous underlying buffer. public MemoryStream GetStream(string tag, int requiredSize, bool asContiguousBuffer) Parameters tag string A tag which can be used to track the source of the stream. requiredSize int The minimum desired capacity for the stream. asContiguousBuffer bool Whether to attempt to use a single contiguous buffer. Returns MemoryStream A MemoryStream. Remarks Retrieving a MemoryStream which provides a single contiguous buffer can be useful in situations where the initial size is known and it is desirable to avoid copying data between the smaller underlying buffers to a single large one. This is most helpful when you know that you will always call GetBuffer on the underlying stream. Events BlockCreated Triggered when a new block is created. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler BlockCreated Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler BlockDiscarded Triggered when a new block is created. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler BlockDiscarded Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler LargeBufferCreated Triggered when a new large buffer is created. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler LargeBufferCreated Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler LargeBufferDiscarded Triggered when a large buffer is discarded, along with the reason for the discard. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.LargeBufferDiscardedEventHandler LargeBufferDiscarded Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.LargeBufferDiscardedEventHandler StreamConvertedToArray Triggered when a user converts a stream to array. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler StreamConvertedToArray Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler StreamCreated Triggered when a new stream is created. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler StreamCreated Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler StreamDisposed Triggered when a stream is disposed. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler StreamDisposed Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler StreamFinalized Triggered when a stream is finalized. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler StreamFinalized Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.EventHandler StreamLength Triggered when a stream is finalized. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.StreamLengthReportHandler StreamLength Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.StreamLengthReportHandler UsageReport Periodically triggered to report usage statistics. public event RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.UsageReportEventHandler UsageReport Event Type RecyclableMemoryStreamManager.UsageReportEventHandler

index.html.title: | PD
index.html.keywords: 说明 文档统一放在manual目录下，markdown格式，支持用文件夹分类，目录会自动生成 MarkDown语法参考 建议在 vs code 安装MarkDown插件进行编辑 安装环境 命令行运行检查是否已安装 dotnet dotnet --version dontnet官方网站 安装好 dotnet 之后，运行 install.bat，即可 Build 生成manual 运行 build_site.bat，自动更新目录 生成api 运行 build_api.bat，自动生成Unity工程中Framework、HotUpdate两个asmdef的API参考 代码注释格式如下，将自动生成到api帮助文档 namespace MyNamespace { /// <summary> /// Enter description here for class X. /// ID string generated is "T:MyNamespace.MyClass". /// </summary> public unsafe class MyClass { /// <summary> /// Enter description for method someMethod. /// ID string generated is "M:MyNamespace.MyClass.someMethod(System.String,System.Int32@,System.Void*)". /// </summary> /// <param name="str">Describe parameter.</param> /// <param name="num">Describe parameter.</param> /// <param name="ptr">Describe parameter.</param> /// <returns>Describe return value.</returns> public int someMethod(string str, ref int nm, void* ptr) { return 1; } } } 全部生成 运行 build_all.bat，生成manual和api 查看文档 运行 run.bat，将打开网页定位到http://127.0.0.1:8081/

manual/GPUSkinning.html.title: Getting Started | PD
manual/GPUSkinning.html.keywords: Getting Started 1、 新建一个空的场景用于采样。 2、 将预制拖入场景。如果有animator主件将其删除。添加Animation主件和GPUSkinning主件。 3、 将要烘培的动作拖入Animation主件，然后刷新下Inspector界面（点击其他资源再点回来就行）。 4、 设置烘培相关配置，填入Animation Name 骨骼数量一般是选Bone2，具体问做动作的美术。 ShaderType选Unlit。 将场景里预制的骨骼根节点拖入Root Bone。 设置动作Wrap Mode，循环动作设置成Loop模式。 5、 点击Play Scene按钮启动场景。然后再点击Start Sampler 6、 点击Preview/Editor进行预览。选择不同的动作查看烘培结果。 7、创新GPUSkinning预制。场景中新建一个空对象，添加GPUSkinningPlayerMono脚本。将生成的数据拖入脚本，然后保存。 手动打开视频

manual/ReferenceList控件绑定.html.title: ReferenceList控件绑定 | PD
manual/ReferenceList控件绑定.html.keywords: ReferenceList控件绑定 绑定 根据组件及其前缀规则，将自动收集绑定信息 前缀及组件类型 类型 简写 Text txt Image img Button btn Dropdown dropDown ScrollRect scrollView ToggleGroup toggleGroup Toggle toggle InputField input TMP_InputField input Scrollbar scrollBar Slider slider CanvasGroup group Animation anim Animator anim ScrollView scrollView ButtonExt btn ImagePicker imgPick UIParticle ufx HorizontalLayoutGroup layout VerticalLayoutGroup layout Note 需首字母小写 自定义组件 类型 简写 ViewInOutAnim inOutAnim UniWebView webView UIParticle VirtrualList virt ScrollViewFocus ScrollViewNested 忽略的组件 类型 ParticleSystem 根结点组件 在根结点包含ReferenceList组件之外还有需要绑定的组件如Image、ButtonExt等等，生成绑定的名称只包含前缀

manual/UI字体样式.html.title: 1、字体模板 | PD
manual/UI字体样式.html.keywords: 1、字体模板 2、 使用规范 ① 字体样式配置 a、字体模板配置 1、在这个目录下配置好字体模板的预制体，该步骤由UE操作， 相应的操作规范在这里 2、配置好后UI需要过一遍效果是否正确, 不正确返回第一步 3、QA再看下配置是否正确导入。不正确返回第一步， 如果找不到问题错在哪，找相关程序查询 b、字体模板使用 当模板配置好之后，就可以在LanguageI18nText组件上看到了， 如下图所示: 总共有以下几种情形: 1、静态文本，静态字体模板 UE直接在预制内配置好即可 2、静态文本，动态字体模板 UE在预制内配置好多语言key，动态字体模板需要程序根据业务设置，代码如下所示: label.SetFontStyle(FontStyleDef.***); // 在LanguageI18nText有相应的接口 public void SetFontStyle(FontStyleDef newStyle) => SetFontStyle(newStyle, false); 3、动态文本，静态字体模板 UE配置好字体模板，如果需要格式化的话，UE需要在预制内配置好格式化选项 程序根据业务实际情况设置文本，如果发现与UE设置不一致，根据情况同步UE 4、动态文本，动态字体模板 UE配置好基础项即可，其他交由程序处理 c、富文本 富文本有几种情况大致如下: 1、静态 直接在多语言内配置好即可 2、动态 需要程序根据业务设置不同模板

manual/UI资源预加载.html.title: UI资源预加载 | PD
manual/UI资源预加载.html.keywords: UI资源预加载 在打开UI界面时，应在所有图片、图标和预制体等资源异步加载完毕后，再显示UI界面。 实现原理是在创建UI界面时，先不显示UI（将其挂到HiddenCanvas），UIManager在Create View时创建一个AsyncLoadStates，传递到该界面的Mediator、View、Control负责收集异步加载的Task，最后在所有异步加载完毕时，将UI显示（将其挂到创建时指定的目标Canvas Layer下） public abstract class MediatorBase : Notifier { // ... protected AsyncLoadStates AsyncLoadStates; internal void Initialize(AsyncLoadStates asyncLoadStates, object param) { // ... this.AsyncLoadStates = asyncLoadStates; // ... } } public class ComponentBase : Disposable { // ... protected AsyncLoadStates AsyncLoadStates; public void Initialize(ReferenceList referenceList, AsyncLoadStates asyncLoadStates) { { // ... this.AsyncLoadStates = asyncLoadStates; // ... } } 异步加载资源的代码部分增加支持AsyncLoadStates的BeginLoad和EndLoad public static async void SetSpriteAsync(this Image self, ArrayStruct<string> iconPath, AsyncLoadStates asyncLoadStates) { var ar = asyncLoadStates?.BeginLoad("SetSprite") ?? default; try { var sprite = await IResourceMgr.Instance.LoadSpriteAsync(iconPath); self.sprite = sprite; } finally { asyncLoadStates?.EndLoad(ar); } } 调用异步资源加载时，直接传Mediator/View的AsyncLoadStates，如果不需要传null img_Icon.SetSpriteAsync(item.Config.Icon, this.AsyncLoadStates);

manual/getting_started/git使用规范.html.title: commit 规范 | PD
manual/getting_started/git使用规范.html.keywords: commit 规范 提交 格式 功能名称: 内容 一次只提交一个功能，或者一个bug修改 例子: xx功能or单号:提交内容 xx功能bug:修复xx问题 特殊: doc: 添加xx文档 build: 构建信息 art: 美术资源 分支管理 dev为主干分支 开发功能从主干分出feature分支 若要同步主干的内容，使用git rebase dev feature分之开发稳定后合回dev分支,使用 git merge --no-ff

manual/getting_started/命名规范.html.title: 命名规范 | PD
manual/getting_started/命名规范.html.keywords: 命名规范 命名方法 命名采用驼峰规则，不采用下划线分割规则。 文件夹与文件命名 所有文件夹与文件:首字母大写。 命名空间 类 接口 枚举 函数 委托和事件 属性 常量 使用首字母大写 变量 局部变量:首字母小写。 私有与保护成员变量:_首字母小写 公有成员变量:首字母小写 namespace Framework.Style { using UnityEngine; using UnityEngine.UI; using System.Collections; using System.Collections.Generic; // 展示编码风格 public enum EnumStyle { Style1 = 0, Style2, Style3, MaxValue } struct StructStyle { public int index; public string str; public Vector3 pos; public Quaternion rotation; } public class ProgrammingStyle : MonoBehaviour { // 私有成员变量 Button _btn; int _curSelectIndex; Vector3[] _positions; GameObject _view; EnumStyle _enumStyle; StructStyle _struct; // public类型变量首字母小写 public int lastIndex = 0; //public只读变量首字母小写 public readonly int initIndex; // 常量使用首字母大写 public const int First = 1; //属性使用首字母大写 public int CurSelectIndex { get { return _curSelectIndex; } } // 函数 void Start () { _view = transform.Find ("MainView").GetComponent<Button>(); // 临时变量命名采用首字母小写驼峰式 GameObject firstPosGo = transform.Find ("FirstPosGo").gameObject; } } }

manual/getting_started/编辑MarkDown.html.title: 编辑MarkDown | PD
manual/getting_started/编辑MarkDown.html.keywords: 编辑MarkDown 推荐使用 VSCode 插件安装 推荐在 VSCode 中安装如下两个插件： Markdown All in One 快捷键 Ctrl+Shift+V 打开Preview面板，实时查看 Paste Image 设置 打开 VS Code 的设置（快捷键为 Ctrl + , 或者 Cmd + ,）。 在设置中搜索 "paste image"。 找到 "Paste Image: Path" 选项，将其设置为 ${projectRoot}/images。这会告诉插件将图片保存在项目根目录下的 images 文件夹内。 快捷键 在 Markdown 文件中，使用快捷键（默认为 Ctrl + Alt + V 或者 Cmd + Alt + V）粘贴图片 打开工作区目录 VSCode 打开目录 PDClient/Doc 作为根目录 Note 这样使用Paste Image粘贴的截图可以正确保存在 PDClient/Doc/images 目录中

manual/日志.html.title: 日志 | PD
manual/日志.html.keywords: 日志 LunarConsole 真机双指从上到下划动屏幕可打开日志界面 日志文件 使用的是log4net库，每次运行在Application.PersistentPath/Log下以当前时间命名生成一份日志文件 Unity Editor中通过菜单【Tools】【Open PersistentPath】进行查看 真机上可以通过 菜单【Tools】【Remote Debug】的FTP面板进行查看/下载 PC端打开日志查看工具，PD_Client\build_tools\log\logServer.exe，载入日志文件进行查看，支持日志分级查看和过滤

manual/资源管理.html.title: 资源管理 | PD
manual/资源管理.html.keywords: 资源管理 生命周期 生命周期 说明 Temp LateUpdate时释放 View 界面关闭时释放 Scene 场景切换时释放 Account 帐号切换时释放 Global 全局，软重启时释放 View Mediator、View、Control中可以直接访问成员变量，为该界面的回收器，资源加载时传递，在界面关闭时会自动调用Addressable的Release var spriteAtlas = await ResourceMgr.Instance.LoadSpriteAtlasAsync("Assets/Art/SpriteAtlas/Main.spriteatlas", ResourceRecycler); ResourceRecyclerMgr Temp、Scene、Account、Global的回收器按如下方式进行访问，同样也是在对应的生命周期内自动回收 var startupSettings = await ResourceMgr.Instance.LoadAssetAsync<StartupSettings>("Assets/Config/StartupSettings.asset", global::Facade.GetInstance().ResourceRecyclers.Temp); 未释放警告 Unity Editor中停止运行游戏时，会对调用了Load未进行释放的Addressable资源进行打印警告
